speaker: IAGO
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: SCENE I. A Sea-port in Cyprus. An open place near the quay.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter MONTANO and two Gentlemen

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: What from the cape can you discern at sea?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Nothing at all: it is a highwrought flood;

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I cannot, 'twixt the heaven and the main,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Descry a sail.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Methinks the wind hath spoke aloud at land;

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: A fuller blast ne'er shook our battlements:

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: If it hath ruffian'd so upon the sea,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: What ribs of oak, when mountains melt on them,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Can hold the mortise? What shall we hear of this?

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: A segregation of the Turkish fleet:

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: For do but stand upon the foaming shore,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: The chidden billow seems to pelt the clouds;

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: The wind-shaked surge, with high and monstrous mane,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: seems to cast water on the burning bear,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: And quench the guards of the ever-fixed pole:

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: I never did like molestation view

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: On the enchafed flood.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: If that the Turkish fleet

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Be not enshelter'd and embay'd, they are drown'd:

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: It is impossible they bear it out.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Enter a third Gentleman

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: News, lads! our wars are done.

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: The desperate tempest hath so bang'd the Turks,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: That their designment halts: a noble ship of Venice

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Hath seen a grievous wreck and sufferance

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: On most part of their fleet.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: How! is this true?

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: The ship is here put in,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: A Veronesa; Michael Cassio,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Lieutenant to the warlike Moor Othello,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Is come on shore: the Moor himself at sea,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: And is in full commission here for Cyprus.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: I am glad on't; 'tis a worthy governor.

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: But this same Cassio, though he speak of comfort

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Touching the Turkish loss, yet he looks sadly,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: And prays the Moor be safe; for they were parted

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: With foul and violent tempest.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Pray heavens he be;

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: For I have served him, and the man commands

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Like a full soldier. Let's to the seaside, ho!

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: As well to see the vessel that's come in

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: As to throw out our eyes for brave Othello,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Even till we make the main and the aerial blue

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: An indistinct regard.

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Come, let's do so:

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: For every minute is expectancy

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Of more arrivance.

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Enter CASSIO

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Thanks, you the valiant of this warlike isle,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That so approve the Moor! O, let the heavens

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Give him defence against the elements,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: For I have lost us him on a dangerous sea.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Is he well shipp'd?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: His bark is stoutly timber'd, his pilot

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Of very expert and approved allowance;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Therefore my hopes, not surfeited to death,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Stand in bold cure.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: A cry within 'A sail, a sail, a sail!'

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Enter a fourth Gentleman

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: What noise?

speaker: Fourth Gentleman
text_entry: The town is empty; on the brow o' the sea

speaker: Fourth Gentleman
text_entry: Stand ranks of people, and they cry 'A sail!'

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: My hopes do shape him for the governor.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Guns heard

speaker: Second Gentlemen
text_entry: They do discharge their shot of courtesy:

speaker: Second Gentlemen
text_entry: Our friends at least.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I pray you, sir, go forth,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And give us truth who 'tis that is arrived.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: I shall.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: But, good lieutenant, is your general wived?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Most fortunately: he hath achieved a maid

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That paragons description and wild fame;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: One that excels the quirks of blazoning pens,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And in the essential vesture of creation

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Does tire the ingener.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Re-enter second Gentleman

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: How now! who has put in?

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis one Iago, ancient to the general.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Has had most favourable and happy speed:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Tempests themselves, high seas, and howling winds,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: The gutter'd rocks and congregated sands--

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Traitors ensteep'd to clog the guiltless keel,--

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: As having sense of beauty, do omit

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Their mortal natures, letting go safely by

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: The divine Desdemona.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: What is she?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: She that I spake of, our great captain's captain,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Left in the conduct of the bold Iago,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Whose footing here anticipates our thoughts

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: A se'nnight's speed. Great Jove, Othello guard,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And swell his sail with thine own powerful breath,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That he may bless this bay with his tall ship,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Make love's quick pants in Desdemona's arms,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Give renew'd fire to our extincted spirits

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And bring all Cyprus comfort!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Enter DESDEMONA, EMILIA, IAGO, RODERIGO, and Attendants

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: O, behold,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: The riches of the ship is come on shore!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Ye men of Cyprus, let her have your knees.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Hail to thee, lady! and the grace of heaven,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Before, behind thee, and on every hand,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Enwheel thee round!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I thank you, valiant Cassio.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What tidings can you tell me of my lord?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: He is not yet arrived: nor know I aught

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: But that he's well and will be shortly here.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O, but I fear--How lost you company?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: The great contention of the sea and skies

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Parted our fellowship--But, hark! a sail.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Within 'A sail, a sail!' Guns heard

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: They give their greeting to the citadel;

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: This likewise is a friend.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: See for the news.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Exit Gentleman

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Good ancient, you are welcome.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: To EMILIA

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Welcome, mistress.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Let it not gall your patience, good Iago,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That I extend my manners; 'tis my breeding

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That gives me this bold show of courtesy.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Kissing her

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Sir, would she give you so much of her lips

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As of her tongue she oft bestows on me,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You'll have enough.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas, she has no speech.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: In faith, too much;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I find it still, when I have list to sleep:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Marry, before your ladyship, I grant,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She puts her tongue a little in her heart,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And chides with thinking.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: You have little cause to say so.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Come on, come on; you are pictures out of doors,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Bells in your parlors, wild-cats in your kitchens,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Saints m your injuries, devils being offended,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Players in your housewifery, and housewives' in your beds.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O, fie upon thee, slanderer!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nay, it is true, or else I am a Turk:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You rise to play and go to bed to work.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: You shall not write my praise.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: No, let me not.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What wouldst thou write of me, if thou shouldst

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: praise me?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O gentle lady, do not put me to't;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For I am nothing, if not critical.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Come on assay. There's one gone to the harbour?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Ay, madam.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I am not merry; but I do beguile

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: The thing I am, by seeming otherwise.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Come, how wouldst thou praise me?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I am about it; but indeed my invention

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Comes from my pate as birdlime does from frize;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It plucks out brains and all: but my Muse labours,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And thus she is deliver'd.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If she be fair and wise, fairness and wit,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The one's for use, the other useth it.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Well praised! How if she be black and witty?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If she be black, and thereto have a wit,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She'll find a white that shall her blackness fit.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Worse and worse.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: How if fair and foolish?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She never yet was foolish that was fair;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For even her folly help'd her to an heir.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: These are old fond paradoxes to make fools laugh i'

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: the alehouse. What miserable praise hast thou for

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: her that's foul and foolish?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: There's none so foul and foolish thereunto,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But does foul pranks which fair and wise ones do.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O heavy ignorance! thou praisest the worst best.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But what praise couldst thou bestow on a deserving

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: woman indeed, one that, in the authority of her

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: merit, did justly put on the vouch of very malice itself?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She that was ever fair and never proud,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Had tongue at will and yet was never loud,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Never lack'd gold and yet went never gay,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Fled from her wish and yet said 'Now I may,'

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She that being anger'd, her revenge being nigh,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Bade her wrong stay and her displeasure fly,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She that in wisdom never was so frail

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To change the cod's head for the salmon's tail;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She that could think and ne'er disclose her mind,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: See suitors following and not look behind,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She was a wight, if ever such wight were,--

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To do what?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To suckle fools and chronicle small beer.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O most lame and impotent conclusion! Do not learn

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: of him, Emilia, though he be thy husband. How say

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: you, Cassio? is he not a most profane and liberal

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: counsellor?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: He speaks home, madam: You may relish him more in

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: the soldier than in the scholar.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: [Aside]  He takes her by the palm: ay, well said,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: whisper: with as little a web as this will I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: ensnare as great a fly as Cassio. Ay, smile upon

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: her, do; I will gyve thee in thine own courtship.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You say true; 'tis so, indeed: if such tricks as

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: these strip you out of your lieutenantry, it had

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: been better you had not kissed your three fingers so

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: oft, which now again you are most apt to play the

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: sir in. Very good; well kissed! an excellent

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: courtesy! 'tis so, indeed. Yet again your fingers

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to your lips? would they were clyster-pipes for your sake!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Trumpet within

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The Moor! I know his trumpet.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: 'Tis truly so.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Let's meet him and receive him.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Lo, where he comes!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO and Attendants

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O my fair warrior!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My dear Othello!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It gives me wonder great as my content

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To see you here before me. O my soul's joy!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If after every tempest come such calms,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: May the winds blow till they have waken'd death!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And let the labouring bark climb hills of seas

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Olympus-high and duck again as low

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As hell's from heaven! If it were now to die,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Twere now to be most happy; for, I fear,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My soul hath her content so absolute

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That not another comfort like to this

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Succeeds in unknown fate.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: The heavens forbid

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But that our loves and comforts should increase,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Even as our days do grow!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Amen to that, sweet powers!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I cannot speak enough of this content;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It stops me here; it is too much of joy:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And this, and this, the greatest discords be

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Kissing her

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That e'er our hearts shall make!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: [Aside]  O, you are well tuned now!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But I'll set down the pegs that make this music,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As honest as I am.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Come, let us to the castle.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: News, friends; our wars are done, the Turks

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: are drown'd.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How does my old acquaintance of this isle?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Honey, you shall be well desired in Cyprus;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I have found great love amongst them. O my sweet,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I prattle out of fashion, and I dote

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: In mine own comforts. I prithee, good Iago,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Go to the bay and disembark my coffers:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Bring thou the master to the citadel;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: He is a good one, and his worthiness

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Does challenge much respect. Come, Desdemona,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Once more, well met at Cyprus.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exeunt OTHELLO, DESDEMONA, and Attendants

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do thou meet me presently at the harbour. Come

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: hither. If thou be'st valiant,-- as, they say, base

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: men being in love have then a nobility in their

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: natures more than is native to them--list me. The

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: lieutenant tonight watches on the court of

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: guard:--first, I must tell thee this--Desdemona is

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: directly in love with him.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: With him! why, 'tis not possible.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Lay thy finger thus, and let thy soul be instructed.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Mark me with what violence she first loved the Moor,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: but for bragging and telling her fantastical lies:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: and will she love him still for prating? let not

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: thy discreet heart think it. Her eye must be fed;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: and what delight shall she have to look on the

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: devil? When the blood is made dull with the act of

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: sport, there should be, again to inflame it and to

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: give satiety a fresh appetite, loveliness in favour,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: sympathy in years, manners and beauties; all which

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: the Moor is defective in: now, for want of these

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: required conveniences, her delicate tenderness will

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: find itself abused, begin to heave the gorge,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: disrelish and abhor the Moor; very nature will

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: instruct her in it and compel her to some second

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: choice. Now, sir, this granted,--as it is a most

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: pregnant and unforced position--who stands so

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: eminent in the degree of this fortune as Cassio

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: does? a knave very voluble; no further

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: conscionable than in putting on the mere form of

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: civil and humane seeming, for the better compassing

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: of his salt and most hidden loose affection? why,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: none; why, none: a slipper and subtle knave, a

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: finder of occasions, that has an eye can stamp and

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: counterfeit advantages, though true advantage never

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: present itself; a devilish knave. Besides, the

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: knave is handsome, young, and hath all those

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: requisites in him that folly and green minds look

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: after: a pestilent complete knave; and the woman

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: hath found him already.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I cannot believe that in her; she's full of

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: most blessed condition.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Blessed fig's-end! the wine she drinks is made of

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: grapes: if she had been blessed, she would never

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: have loved the Moor. Blessed pudding! Didst thou

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: not see her paddle with the palm of his hand? didst

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: not mark that?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Yes, that I did; but that was but courtesy.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Lechery, by this hand; an index and obscure prologue

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to the history of lust and foul thoughts. They met

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: so near with their lips that their breaths embraced

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: together. Villanous thoughts, Roderigo! when these

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: mutualities so marshal the way, hard at hand comes

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: the master and main exercise, the incorporate

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: conclusion, Pish! But, sir, be you ruled by me: I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: have brought you from Venice. Watch you to-night;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: for the command, I'll lay't upon you. Cassio knows

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: you not. I'll not be far from you: do you find

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: some occasion to anger Cassio, either by speaking

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: too loud, or tainting his discipline; or from what

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: other course you please, which the time shall more

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: favourably minister.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Well.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Sir, he is rash and very sudden in choler, and haply

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: may strike at you: provoke him, that he may; for

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: even out of that will I cause these of Cyprus to

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: mutiny; whose qualification shall come into no true

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: taste again but by the displanting of Cassio. So

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: shall you have a shorter journey to your desires by

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: the means I shall then have to prefer them; and the

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: impediment most profitably removed, without the

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: which there were no expectation of our prosperity.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I will do this, if I can bring it to any

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: opportunity.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I warrant thee. Meet me by and by at the citadel:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I must fetch his necessaries ashore. Farewell.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Adieu.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That Cassio loves her, I do well believe it;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That she loves him, 'tis apt and of great credit:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The Moor, howbeit that I endure him not,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is of a constant, loving, noble nature,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And I dare think he'll prove to Desdemona

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: A most dear husband. Now, I do love her too;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Not out of absolute lust, though peradventure

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I stand accountant for as great a sin,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But partly led to diet my revenge,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For that I do suspect the lusty Moor

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Hath leap'd into my seat; the thought whereof

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Doth, like a poisonous mineral, gnaw my inwards;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And nothing can or shall content my soul

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Till I am even'd with him, wife for wife,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Or failing so, yet that I put the Moor

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: At least into a jealousy so strong

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That judgment cannot cure. Which thing to do,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If this poor trash of Venice, whom I trash

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For his quick hunting, stand the putting on,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I'll have our Michael Cassio on the hip,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Abuse him to the Moor in the rank garb--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For I fear Cassio with my night-cap too--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Make the Moor thank me, love me and reward me.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For making him egregiously an ass

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And practising upon his peace and quiet

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Even to madness. 'Tis here, but yet confused:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Knavery's plain face is never seen tin used.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit
